exercises.statement: Prove that eigenvalues of a real symmetric matrix are real.

steps.title: Use symmetry
steps.content: Since $A = A^T$, $\langle Av, v \rangle = \langle v, Av \rangle$, so $\lambda = \bar{\lambda}$.

exercises.statement: Prove that eigenvectors of a symmetric matrix corresponding to distinct eigenvalues are orthogonal.

steps.title: Compute
steps.content: $\lambda_1 \langle v_1, v_2 \rangle = \langle Av_1, v_2 \rangle = \langle v_1, Av_2 \rangle = \lambda_2 \langle v_1, v_2 \rangle$.

steps.title: Conclude
steps.content: $(\lambda_1 - \lambda_2)\langle v_1, v_2 \rangle = 0$, and since $\lambda_1 \neq \lambda_2$, we have $\langle v_1, v_2 \rangle = 0$.

solution.conclusion: Eigenvectors for distinct eigenvalues are orthogonal.
